address: 27J Đ. Trần Nhật Duật, Phường Tân Định, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Fine dinning Viet fusion food in Tran Nhat Duat street D1. Every dish is well thought over and cooked to perfection, omg tasted amazing!!!!! Everything well balanced wth a bit of tang and the sweet zestiness. Cocktails decorated beautiful. Nice restaurant and staff are very friendly.
Appetizers were good, but the Calamari was a bit 'chewy'. Seafood linguine was very tasty and surprisingly spicy. Service was excellent, and overall experience was pleasing.
Very nice and cozy atmosphere. The food is generally good but I think western style dishes are better than Vietnamese ones.

reviews.user_review:

Clean restaurant with ample seating . …
Seafood is fresh and nice, price is moderate (not cheap not quite expensive). No aircon in 1st floor and lunch time. Will come back!

Outdoor, but if you looking for fresh catch it just perfect out of the tank. Plenty of fish or anytime of seashell that you looking for. Only serve beer they take cork charge so can bring sake or shoju

reviews.user_review: District 2 has grown so much. Now you can find a lot of food and restaurant, that used to require you to go to d1 or somewhere else, in the area. Having a pretty decent bánh xèo place in d2 is an example. They serve different fillings for …

Lovely place for family time and eatery. Quite place with friendly staffs. Good menu with manu options of VNese meals. Quite good location however very small parking area (for bikes), cars can park on the road. In the beginning of the year A restaurant had been renew the menu
Enjoyed, excellent vietnames cusine.

reviews.user_review: This branch has a lovely garden setting and serves a variety of Vietnamese dishes from all over the country. It’s a great choice for tourists wanting to try classic, familiar flavors without anything too adventurous. The food is solid, the prices are moderate, and it’s a nice spot for a relaxed meal with regional dishes.

Been here multiple times. Highly recommended by Vietnamese colleagues and expats. Must try item is tofu with tomatoes. Recommended to eat with any stir fried vegetable. Ordered steamed fish but was very salty and dry. Vegetables and …

Dined at this Vietnamese Restaurant during my visit for a conference. The conference organizers took us to this restaurant for the dinner. The whole restaurant was booked by the conference organizers for us. The restaurant had a cozy look. …

reviews.user_review: DO NOT COME HERE!!! Waiters looked so depressed. Roast chicken took nearly 1 hour. VERY Small portions. Fried rice is bland. Not good value for money. I would never recommend anyone to come here! The worst VN restaurant!
Overpriced for the small size portions received. The service wasnt up to the standard for such expensive restaurant, and members of staff were disorganised and manager had no control. …

All dishes we tried were amazing. Excellent services: fast, attentive, friendly. Price was pretty high but we are offered to choose a favorite dish to get it for free in the next visit!!! A cheeky and cheerful way to make your customers return.

This place is nice and cozy, we do have to make a reservation. The vibe of this place was different and unique and i loved that. …

reviews.user_review: The food was quite good. Delicious with reasonable price. The waitress who named Blink can speak fluent English and her service is professional. We enjoyed our time there. Would definitely go again!

I had an amazing dining experience at Home Saigon! Four of us ate here, and every dish was delicious and beautifully presented. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot to enjoy authentic Vietnamese cuisine. …

Food was great. Ni and Mi were great!
The fried fish was good too...not fishy at all.   i highly recommend the coconut coffee :) …

Food is pretty decent - a tad of a modern Vietnamese. Try their crispy rice and propaganda salad. Place fills up quickly in the evening. Largely expat crowd. Price point is good for the quality of food. Super chill atmosphere.  Recommended

Great flavours in a bustling, air-conditioned environment. Had the roast chicken with broken rice alongside fried fishcake, and both were great. Reasonable prices and excellent service too. This is the place to go after wandering about the …

Definitely a good spot to eat and people watch at the same time. Food is delicious and service is. The staff are super friendly and speak English
Food was fine, but didn't blow my mind. Coconut fried rice didn't have much flavor and the steamed fish was a little tough to take apart. The steamed fish did have good flavor though.

reviews.user_review: The seafood very fresh, we love the lobster, this is third time , thế lobster head cook with porridge. So nice , we very satisfied. Flower crab is the best too 💪🏻💪🏻🤩🥰 …
Sea food in HCM for the first time.  Seafoods are fresh but sauce is not spicy ad much as Thai's seafood sauce.  Prices quite high but worth to pay.

Seafood is fresh.  Service is too notch.  I can't believe they not only peel the shrimp for you.  But as you eat they come and pick the empty shells from your plate as well.  Not used to this level of service in the states.  Seems to be …

reviews.user_review: Came here a little earlier than their operating hours (they open at 11:00 am) but they still offered us seats and drinks. Staff are very nice. Tried a few shellfish and snails. Loved all of them. They even gave us free balut because we …

My 2nd visit to this place
Most of the shellfishes are really fresh. I think because of their popularity, the quantity of the food shrink. It became smaller portion …

Very good shell food in the city. Its a more local places. They have many options for snails. You will need google translate to communicate but otherwise its okay. What i did not like was that they hurry you with the order

restaurant_name: Nhà Hàng Cơm Niêu Việt Nam
address: 234 Đ. Cộng Hòa, Phường 12, Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
This is a traditional Vietnamese restaurant, offering a variety of food, and the rice served in an earthenware pot like Korean stone pot rice is  delicious. When you pour hot water on the rice that has been burned in Onggi and soak it, it tastes almost the same as scorched rice.
It tasted like a Korean country table.
There are large and small rooms from the 1st to 3rd floors, so it is convenient for individuals or groups to dine.
Here is good for enjoying meal with family or friend. They have lots of spaces on 2nd and 3rd floor. The food is delicious too.
Food are ok just a bit problem with servicing staff

address: Second floor, 42 Nguyễn Huệ, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Poké Saigon is an absolute gem! Their poke bowls are amazing—super fresh, packed with flavour, and loaded with a wide variety of ingredients to choose from. Whether you prefer classic salmon or something more adventurous, there’s something for everyone. The portions are generous, and the prices are surprisingly affordable for the quality you get.

The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming, making the experience even better. The atmosphere is lovely, with a relaxed and modern vibe that’s perfect for a quick lunch or a casual dinner. If you’re in Saigon and craving something fresh and delicious, this is definitely the place to go!

Came here after a long bus journey and the bowl was super good. There was a large selection of toppings and poke. The servers were also super sweet and helpful when deciding what to get and checking up on us. Overall super delicious and a large portion too

I’d recommend their vegetarian poke bowl & chocolate mousse😋😋, I’m so glad my friend introduced me to this place definitely gonna keep ordering more in the future. Everything was genuinely great from customer service/atmosphere to food. After eating I felt so full so for the price it was worth it. I love how u can customize ur own poke bowl and the ladies were so sweet and friendly 🫶🏻

Their house made sauces are irresistible & fantastic job done on their vegetarian/vegan version of tuna prolly outdid normal tuna at this point.

restaurant_name: HỦ TÍU CHÚ THÀNH | Hủ Tíu Ngon Quận 1 | Hủ Tíu Chú Thành Quận 1 |
address: 61 P. Đức Chính, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Solid 10/10 hủ tíu mì. Mine was tossed mì with spare ribs. Delicious and great value for money. Definitely recommended.

Got the spare rib noodles and the nam vang noodles (which is a mix of meats, offal and shrimp) - very light, refreshing broth that you can season to suit ur preference. The spare rib noodles is the star imo. Also owner speaks some english so she can assist with orders. Bonus that the environment feels very clean.

We had a very delicious meal here and they serve fresh seafood and meat . The noodle is very delicious and the restaurant is clean and staff is friendly .
Highly recommended!

restaurant_name: Nhà Hàng Quán Ăn Gia Đình Ngon - Quán Ăn Bắc Gần Sân Bay - Ngon rẻ Tphcm
address: 234 Đ. Cộng Hòa, Phường 12, Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh 72111, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Best Can Chua (sweet and sour fish soup) in Saigon!  Well, I actually don't know if it is thr best but who will prove me wrong! One way or another it is incredibly tasty. In fact, all food here is amazing with menu scribbled on a piece of paper in Vietnamese that changes every day. Love this place

Ok food... the price is low. There is an upstairs section with air con but it is not strong enough.
Service is good.
True authentic Vietnamese food; northern taste.

address: 160 Pasteur, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Apr 2025: great ambience and lovely place for a mid size group gathering. Wide selection of food within the menu for all tastes and preferences. We had the steak and fries + crab meat vermicelli dish. Both were v good. Of mention is the bun that came with the steak. Crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Wonderful!

Disappointing restaurant. Looks charming and filled with tourists. But service staff is rude and rushed. Food is really mediocre. Can you imagine a dish with French fries added to prawns pancake? And fried squid that tasted like fried eraser - good hard work for the jaws. Menu is super extensive… too extensive. Maybe they should focus on getting a few dishes done really well instead

One of the most beautiful interiors of a restaurant that we've seen. Perfect for a romantic date in HCMC.

Has a wide range of food choices that you can choose from. Staff understands basic English, it would be nice thou if they could smile more :)

Overall a nice experience. Will come back again!

restaurant_name: Bún Thịt Nướng Chả Giò - Nguyễn Trung Trực
address: 1 Nguyễn Trung Trực, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Love this place and the fantastic bowl of noodles with fried spring roll and grilled pork. The rustic charm of sitting by the roadside, on a plastic chair and chowing down on great Vietnamese food is captured well here, and I consider it a great coup to have this while wandering through the city centre. Dip the spring rolls into the sauce and mix up the noodles with some of it for a great experience. Flavours were excellent and the place was no frills. A great find.

This street food stall is set up right in front of a shop, but the quality of the food is truly excellent. Everything is fresh. The noodles are dry-style, served separately from the sauce. The spring rolls are incredibly crunchy, and the grilled pork is delicious, offering a sweet-savory flavor similar to Babi Panggang Karo for Indonesian taste buds.

The price is very reasonable considering the high-quality foods. If you're around Ben Thanh Market or just visiting HMC Post Office or Notre-Dame Cathedral, you should definitely look for this place.

I went during brunch hours, so it wasn’t too crowded—perfect for a relaxed meal

The best grilled pork I’ve ever had. The combination of pork and rice noodle is perfectly cooked. Both refreshing and very tasty. They don’t have a restaurant building but everyone eat on the sidewalk. It costs around 65k VND for a bowl of Bun Thit Nuong. Very recommended.

restaurant_name: Asiana Food Town (Chợ Ẩm Thực Dưới Lòng Đất)
address: Khu B công viên 23, 4 Đ. Phạm Ngũ Lão, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Nice get away from the heat and traffic. AC and restroom and food court hangout place. Not as many choices as Saigon Square but no hussling like Ben Thanh.
Very clean area underground with food, clothes,… Free toilet & aircon. Many chairs inside so you even could take some nap before exploring more about Saigon.

Small, upmarket food court in a prime location—perfect for sampling a wide variety of Vietnamese dishes. The selection is fantastic, the prices are good, and the food is generally excellent. A highly recommended one-stop option for everything delicious in Saigon, whether you're a first-time visitor or a local foodie.

2025 Update: The original Asiana Food Town is gone. In its place, there’s a new food court—more spacious but with fewer stalls and less variety. That said, this is still Saigon, so there’s no shortage of great food, and the prices remain very reasonable.

address: 19 Ngô Văn Năm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Everything we ordered hit the table like a flavor bomb—bold, amazing flavors in every bite! The Vietnamese prawn pancakes were the only miss here (not recommended), too bland compared to everything else we tried. Still, we were too hooked on the standout dishes to mind much.

Our waitress was a champ, patient and on point with our big group. The jasmine IPA from a local brewery was sensational. Highly recommend this spot! 😍👌🏼

Very nice place with cool atmosphere! Has a first floor with a balcony where you can eat didn’t see that! The fried half chicken was nothing special just as you expect fried chicken with not much seasoning. The beef with vegetables and the fried rice with garlic and egg were delicious! Not sure if worth the price we paid here. They have 5% service charge and 8% VAT too. Good overall but won’t come back. Other places much better!

A nice little find after a day of travelling. After perusing the 54-page magazine of a menu (seriously, 54 pages!) I ordered glass noodles with prawns and crab. The portion of prawns was a little light - there were only two - but the rest of the ingredients were very well balanced and delicious. The restaurant felt open, light and breezy in the warm evening. Service was excellent. Prices we’re a bit high for Vietnam, but very reasonable compared to North American standards. I would return.

restaurant_name: Quán Ụt Ụt Võ Văn Kiệt | Q.1
address: 177 Đ. Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: A good place to visit, very nice people
Ok

A few days ago, when I passed by the restaurant, my friend pulled me in to try it. I really couldn't imagine that a restaurant that was quite so big would be so disappointed. . About the food: that day I ordered a sparrow combo that included sticky rice, the bird was okay but the sticky rice was extremely hard, hard like sticky rice dried in the sun.. and the crab hotpot had too few ingredients and was not worth the price. . I hate this restaurant's hot pot stove the most. It's an old-fashioned stove that doesn't have a fire extinguisher for children, so the fire keeps burning, with the fan blowing in, so I have to sit far away, otherwise it will burn. Both face and hair should... As for the chopsticks at the shop, I don't know what kind of chopsticks they are, but they smell like moldy wood. I replaced a second pair and still had that smell... Finally, the restaurant staff's way of interviewing me felt like they weren't professionally trained. I sat downstairs that day and there were only 3 tables, but I saw a bunch of them outside walking around laughing and texting. Ordering everything takes a long time. You have to order several times before it comes out. After eating, calling to pay takes a long time. It's not just me who was upset with her, the families sitting near me that day also expressed their anger towards the staff.. in general, I'll never come back.

address: 38 Lý Tự Trọng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: I had an amazing dining experience at Tutk Tuk Thai Bistro in Ho Chi Minh! The food was absolutely excellent. The Pork Minced with Basil was a perfect balance of flavors, with the basil giving it a fresh and aromatic punch. The Shrimp Green Curry was incredibly rich and creamy, with just the right level of spice to make it flavorful without overwhelming the taste buds. And the Tom Kha Soup was the highlight – warm, comforting, and packed with a perfect blend of coconut milk, lemongrass, and spices. The ambiance was cozy, and the service was top-notch. Highly recommend this place for anyone craving authentic Thai food!

Good selection of Thai dishes. Friendly service, food came out fast, and great presentation of food (see pictures). Great and unique selection of mock/cocktails — definitely want to come back and try more. Delicious mango sticky rice with purple rice (something I hadn’t seen before), which is always a plus. Good atmosphere and reasonable prices.
I’m not a thai food fan but gotta say food here is 10/10. Def should try this place guys. Staffs are also supportive & professional. I love the soup & mango sticky rice the most.

restaurant_name: Cơm Quê Dượng Bầu - Vietnamese Homecooked Cuisine
address: Chung cư, 40E Ngô Đức Kế, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 75000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Ticks all the right places. A promise of great night out with a few friends turns into much fun, laughter and camaraderie. The did was typically southern Vietnamese. The snails were exotic though common with locals. But it was big snails. The meat was still retained in chunks for the texture and mouth-feel. It was not overwhelmed by black pepper. Overall great dish. Anything with prawns are good. The prawns here are fresh and juicy. The Banh Xeo again street food cooked with a toichbif glass here. There is so much to be enjoyed here to be honest looking at their menu. More trips!

Food was tasty, although it’s a little pricey. More for tourist, but you can probably get good local equivalent else where. The waiters didn’t seem to do much helping either.

Their signature prawn coconut cracker was alright, won’t be the most memorable. Ginger claypot chicken and the stir fried pumpkin flower was a good standard. Sweet and sour Fish soup recommended by them was a lot of bones and little meat. Would recommend going for a meatier fish.

Overall ,it’s paired well with white rice.

Maybe that day was a bad day for me.
When I went to the restaurant, I saw that the bowl was chipped and asked for a change, and the staff said it was the restaurant's style, but I saw that the bowls at other tables were not like that?
The rice is not fully cooked
Tastewood soup with okra is as viscous as when you eat steamed whole okra.
The bowl of shrimp pasteare sold at a fairly high price (35k / very small bowl).

address: 32-34 Ngô Đức Kế, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: I had such a great experience here today, from the food to the service and atmosphere. Fresh and alive seafood is what makes this place stand out from the rest. They also have a unique style dry aged fish which was absolutely amazing and flavorful. I recommend trying the steamed egg with truffle sauce, best one I’ve had so far. Though price range is high but the experience is worth it, as the location is in district 1 with nice view so that’s understandable.

Came here to try the new dry aged fish and Wow it did not disappoint! The quality was on-par with if not better than what I’ve had in Australia. Their steamed egg with truffle is another Must try, velvety and decadent but most importantly flavourful. It’s city central location and incredible rooftop view justifies the respectable price-tag.
Will be back next time for their In-House Smoked Salmon!

This is a luxury restaurant with an extremely beautiful location right in the center of Ho Chi Minh City. This area will be very difficult to park a car.
The restaurant serves high-value seafood, besides that is a traditional Vietnamese menu. When experiencing here, I feel that the chef cooks very well, the dishes are displayed on the table are delicious and beautiful.
Guests coming here will be able to use private rooms to enjoy, there are musical instruments or karaoke systems in each room to serve when guests have a need. The service staff is very professional and is always present in the dining room to ensure the requests of guests.
The restaurant is suitable for groups of less than 20 people.

address: 136-138 Lê Thị Hồng Gấm, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
I had brunch at Di Mai at Le Thi Hong Gam, and it was an outstanding experience.

The atmosphere is warm, with strong Vietnamese touches, from the interior to the overall theme.

The food? Absolutely delicious. They offer set menus for 2 to 6 people, divided into North, Central, and South Vietnam, making it easy to explore regional flavors.

The staff are friendly, proactive, and fluent in English, making ordering effortless.

Highly recommended!

I’m so confused about the state of Michelin ratings in Vietnam. We went to Bep Me close by and I thought it was awful.

This restaurant isn’t Michelin rated but I feel is far superior. The only thing I disliked was the can chua was too sweet. Their jackfruit desert was really good and I recommend ordering it.

I must say it was a delightful experience. The authenticity of the Vietnamese cuisine truly stands out. Every dish is a flavorful journey, but the fried spring rolls are my favorite– crispy, delicious, and perfectly seasoned.The hospitality is friendly but not over, making you feel warmly welcomed and well taken care of. The ambiance is comfortable and inviting, making it an ideal spot for a relaxed meal.worth visit again !

address: 138 Đ. Nam Kỳ Khởi Nghĩa, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: First off, you are paying for the location and the setting here. It's almost opposite the palace and has a huge menu spanning over 40 pages, how much choice is too much? It's great if you're in a group, maybe not so good as a solo traveler. I got combo number 2, a Vietnamese coffee and crab meat soup for 304,000k. I enjoyed every single one of the dishes, 5 different appetisers and they all tasted good. The crab meat soup was thick like "geng 羹" in Chinese cuisine and was loaded with crab. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant, the food was good and I liked the setting.

What a gorgeous restaurant, more like a big family restaurant. The aunties are cooking next to the diners, such a wholesome sight to see. Whilst devouring the array of amazing fresh Vietnamese dishes I am in awe of the architecture and maintenance of the space. I would definitely recommend this gem to my friends and family!

I chose the restaurant because it looked popular, and even though I could see empty tables, a big song and dance was made about finding me a place to sit. When I offered to leave they put me in the back corner with a group of children and teens watching loud videos. This wasn’t really a bother, but I struggled to get any server’s attention to order.
The Bún chả was certainly the worst I’ve ever had. The meat was overcooked and flavourless. The noodles and pickled vegetables tasted like they’d gone bad. I didn’t eat them as I was concerned about gastrointestinal upset. I also had a cocktail, which was very very strong. No complaints about that.
The meal was quite cheap and the rest of the restaurant looked nice with good decor. The hotpot that the teens across from me ordered looked quite nice. Maybe order that instead of the Bún chả if you decide to give this place a go.

restaurant_name: Khu Ẩm Thực Bến Phú Lâm
address: 8/11 Tân Hòa Đông, Phường 14, Quận 6, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Quality keeps decreasing especially the crispy pork leg dish. I dined in and bought a take-away crispy pork leg. When I went home and looked at it, I asked myself whether the staff collect the food left from others and re-fry it.
Nice food and place to hang out with friends.

reviews.user_review: This end of district 6 in Saigon is a place foreigners rearly visit. As a consequence the locals are excited by the new visitors. This restaurant is an oasis in what would otherwise be considered a rough area of town. Off the beaten track, you will not find it accidentally. Food is basic, good and cheap.
Not a bad restaurant. But, it's location is not easy to find.
Ok

restaurant_name: Nhà Hàng Gia Phú Phúc Kiến
address: 513 Đ. Gia Phú, Phường 1, Quận 6, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
I discovered this hidden gem, and it truly defines what quality food is all about.
Authentic Chinese. Great decor!
Highly recommend it!

Love this place, amazing food and atmosphere! Come here a bunch of times with friends and family, always satisfied. I Like the way they serves me and my Family, friends. The manager here absolutely friendly and kindly.
Sometimes they really really busy and take time to wait but It’s okay for me  ! Good place always busy.
My favorite place… price was good with quality, really authentic Chinese food… the hotpot must try… highly recommend

address: Hẻm 178 Hậu Giang, Phường 2, Quận 6, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
I found this place on the internet from a popular reviewer. Thought it looked delicious so i decided to try it once.

Been on a heavy rain day, but its still crowded. We ordered soured spicy hotpot with beef’s bones.
Everything seems to be usual as other restaurants til i tried the broth its really amazing the sweetness from bones and spicy sourness from chillies. Thats why this restaurant fully packed.

Rolling chopped beef in the broth is actually good i must say. I remembered i had this kind of broth before and it’s in my memories already.

Acceptable price and wonderful meal from a local restaurant.
Great

Cha Ba Beef Hot Pot Restaurant – Quality Exceeds Expectations, Heartwarming Service
After visiting the restaurant on the weekend, after wandering around a few places, all the tables were full. At first I thought it was unlucky when the restaurant said it was out of food and did not accept customers. But actually, the reason is that the restaurant is worried about being crowded and the service is not attentive enough. A little tip for anyone who comes in a similar situation: just wait patiently, there's a high chance you'll still get a table.
The restaurant is quite large, with tables arranged along the sidewalk so there is open space. However, because there are too many customers, it is inevitable to feel a bit hot, especially during peak hours.
Going with 2 people, we ordered a hot and sour mixed beef hotpot and two grilled parts (pork breast and sausage), but there was so much food that we couldn't finish it and had to take it home. The big plus is that the hotpot broth is very unique, rich, sour, mildly spicy, and still not salty until the end. The marinated grilled dishes are delicious, the portions are large, but the waiting time is about 20-30 minutes, so those in a hurry can consider it.
The staff is full of big guys who look "rough" but are extremely dedicated and thoughtful in their service. Total damage is only 260k for 2 people, full stomach. Not to mention the restaurant also offers free all auxiliary dishes such as noodles, noodles, dry tissues, parking... Too impressive at this price!
There are no negative points, in the future when I crave beef hotpot, I'm willing to go a little further away to come back to visit the restaurant!!!!!

The hotpot is a bit salty and a little more sugar is ok. A portion of hot pot is also quite filling. Grilled pork breast is marinated a bit sweet, the spices cover up the typical smell so it is no longer special, the restaurant seasoned the marinade to be lighter. Fatty intestines, on the other hand, are delicious. The waiters looked a bit scared but were very attentive to the customers and kind and cheerful. Free parking shop. Will come back if there is a chance. Affordable price.

address: 529A Đ. Hậu Giang, Phường 11, Quận 6, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: I had the pleasure of dining at Thuyen Am Thuc Chay Quan 6 in Ho Chi Minh, and I must say, it’s a fantastic spot! The owner is incredibly hardworking and honest, always coming up with creative new ideas for the restaurant. The food is absolutely delicious—prepared with skill and love. If you're a local or a vegetarian fanatic, this is a place you simply have to try! The dishes are flavorful, fresh, and inventive. Highly recommend it for anyone looking for amazing vegetarian food. A hidden gem in the city!

Yummy food.
Good price.
Nice staff.
The place is a bit small.

If you want a vegan meal at affordable price, this place is a must-try. The restaurant is cozy and quiet, accompanied by calming music. Staffs are friendly and there are many interesting dishes( all strictly vegan). Will come back to try out the whole menu.

address: 3rd Floor, 91 Mạc Thị Bưởi, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: I stumbled on this restaurant looking for a New Year meal and it was a very nice surprise. I chose the Stylish menu and the dishes featuring Vietnamese ingredients. It really struck me how fresh, yet familiar, the flavours felt. There was one off-menu item: the black bread and white sauce featuring bacon,  manchego cheese, truffles and others if I can remember a few of the ingredients... That was also wipe the bowl clean delicious so the chef really knows how to use Asian and western flavours well. The service level is of a very high calibre and I didn't have to wait long between courses. I'm really glad there are Vietnamese chefs taking the cuisine to new directions, it can only get better from here!

Second time back at Monkey Gallery, this time for dinner.

Had the Stylish menu this time, 4 courses.

Every course was meticulously prepared and served at a good pacing. Tastes good as well!
Just a pity the duck was not available.

Special thank you to Rita for your impeccable hospitality (:

See you guys again soon! Thank you team !

I’d been curious about this restaurant for a long time, until today I finally had chance to try it. The staffs welcomed and guide me to the table with my name tag on it. I chose tasting menu which inspired by the color palette, with 9 dishes based on 9 colors.

Every dish was well presented and took me from one surprise to another. They were all different but connected to each other in some ways.
I especially love the brown, yellow, and orange ones. Tonight, I were given an off menu dish (B&W) which look very simple but absolutely amazing.
I did enjoy the atmosphere of the restaurant, the service there. The staffs were very friendly, caring; they explained every dishes clearly and also gave a suggestion on how to enjoy it.
I sat at the counter and had chance to have some chit chat with the chef. By that, I knew how much thought he had put into this menu and appreciated it more.
At the end of the meal, they also gave me a small jar of jam as a gift. How lovely they are.

I think that this menu is not for every one because the price is on the high-end side and needs to have some dining experience to enjoy it to the fullest. For me, I love every aspects of it and already start saving money for their next menu.

address: 133 Đ. Nguyễn Du, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Great hidden gem. The kid that took our order was very sassy but his English was pretty good. He was a funny guy. The pork skewers were amazing. I would go back for them. The dishes portions were a little small for me. But it's a good place for a snack. Good tasting meals.

Our tour guide Khang brought us to this wonderful restaurant for lunch. Everything was delicious, especially the fish dish. After lunch we had the egg coffee. Another delicious surprise.  Our server was darling and spoke perfect English. A great experience all around ❤️
Vi is excellent hostess. The food was amazing and the hospitality so friendly. Thank you for the best lunch we have had in Vietnam. Those stuffed courgette tempura are 11/10.

address: 48 Đường Nguyễn Văn Mai, Phường 8, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Dinner tonight was a pleasant surprise! This restaurant is tucked away in a small alley way. My favourites are:
1) Camembert cheese - there a slight tinge of lemon grass (just a little bit!) which gave it so much balance!
2) Mushroom Ravioli in Pumpkin Soup
3) Mac and Cheese - hearty without being over powering
4) Garlic bread was done so well too!
Ended the dinner with a creme brulee, you can’t go wrong with it! Thank you Hiêu, for your service tonight!

exquisite and expensive-looking interior and decor, very romantic setting, and toilet is clean. staff are friendly and attentive :)

we ordered:
- burrata salad: burrata was too firm, texture is like mozzarella
- french onion soup: tasty but serving is a little small
- gnocchi no.85 with salami: chef recommended, but pasta was just shell pasta and not gnocci ☹️
- clam pasta with chili oil: clams were fresh, flavour was okay but texture was overcooked/mushy
- fettuccine with lemon cream: flavour was a little blend and texture was okay

overall you might not like the pasta if you like al dente noodles 😢 but everything was affordable

The presentation and decoration of the dish are quite eye-catching, but the taste is quite normal—nothing special. The drinks in the signature non-alcoholic are okay.

The space is quite minimal and cozy, but the tables are a bit too close together.

The waiter needed to pay more attention to the guest when we had to call many times to get his attention (he was busy with his mobile phone) and pay more attention to customers' requests (getting the bill, the sauce)

Overall, the place need to pay more attention to quality than appearance. There are so many better options out there, and hopefully next time I visit, this place will be different.
(was here on April 26, around 7pm on 2nd floor)

address: 391 Võ Văn Tần, Phường 5, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Did not like the Hu Tieu Nam Vang. I am ok with organ meat, ate plenty of while living in Korea for years. Possibly due to not getting the condiments right. Too many sauces and pickled veggies (luv that) to get right. Staff explained the condiments but poor English. Desert was nice: Carmelized tamarind

If there is one place in Saigon that embodies the soul of a perfect bowl of Hủ Tiếu, it’s Hủ Tiếu Hồng Phát. This isn’t your average street-side noodle stall, this is a Michelin-starred institution (2023 & 2024) serving up bowls of pure umami magic without the eye-watering price tag of a French Laundry tasting menu.

The broth is a masterpiece, a deep and complex symphony of flavors simmered for 24 hours, pork bones, beef, a hint of dried squid, and who knows what other secret alchemy.  Each sip coats your tongue with rich, velvety depth, something between a comforting embrace and an umami uppercut.  This is the kind of broth that tells a story one of long hours, meticulous care, and generations of noodle-making mastery.

Then, there are the noodles. Fresh, soft, and delicate, not the chewy, fermented Hủ Tiếu Mỹ Tho variety, but something more refined.  Each strand soaks up the broth beautifully, carrying every bit of that porky, beefy goodness straight to your taste buds. And the toppings? A generous mix of succulent pork, plump shrimp, and fresh herbs, all working in perfect harmony. If you want to take things up a notch, get the hotpot of broth with bone-in meat and blood cake a true family-style feast that well make you feel like a local.

This is the kind of meal that sticks with you. The kind that makes you sit back, exhale, and wonder how something so simple can be so damn good!

If Gordon Ramsay had his mind blown by a bowl of Hủ Tiếu on the Mekong Delta, then this place is the refined, urban version of that experience without the need for a boat.

So do yourself a favor: come hungry, bring friends, and don’t rush. Let the broth, the noodles, and the Michelin-star magic do the talking.

Stingy w/ meat! Disappointing Egg Noodles at a Michelin-Starred Restaurant

With Michelin recognition comes a level of expectation, but the egg noodles at this establishment were a complete letdown. The portion size was surprisingly small—barely enough for a few bites. Instead of the rich, springy texture one hopes for, the noodles were bland.
For the price and reputation, I expected far more but unfortunately, Hồng Phát failed to deliver.

address: 16 Lê Quý Đôn, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Had a delicious dinner here. When we need a meal that doesn't involve a plastic stool and scooter exhaust (which isn't very often,) we try to stick with traditional Vietnamese elevated, or with a modern twist, but always done right and you get what you pay for here. Servers were lovely, ambiance was great and the food was fantastic.

We started with the Nha Trang Jelly Fish salad which blew us away. Followed that up with Grilled Clams wrapped in Caul Fat. Another winner that made us wish there were more than 5.

We then had the 1/2 chicken in fish sauce glaze and the marinated Anchovy fried rice.

Finished it off with the green bean dessert I'm forgetting the name of but it hit the spot.

Fabulous meal.

This restaurant truly delivers an exceptional dining experience. The food is absolutely delicious, showcasing the authentic flavors of Nha Trang's specialties. Each dish is packed with fresh ingredients and masterful seasoning, leaving a lasting impression on the taste buds.

The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always serving with a warm smile and ready to accommodate any requests. Their welcoming attitude makes the experience even more enjoyable.

One of the standout features here is the generous portion sizes. You’ll definitely get great value for your money, as the servings are more than enough to satisfy even the hungriest of appetites.

Nha Trang foods in Sai Gon.
The food was nice but the price was pretty high.  If you want to try different kinds of foods you must go with groups of 4 people up, so you can get more orders.

address: 260C Pasteur, Phường 8, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Choose this place as my dinner when arrive at Hoi Chi Minh, as first timer in Vietnam, this place serve amazing pho. Many local came here. I ordered pho chin and summer roll, the service was fast. I think all restaurant in Hoi Chi Minh serve other vegetable as condiment, the local really like vegetables. The pho had light soup, tender meat. The summer roll just so-so, but i loved the sauce. The cashier man also kind. Not regret choose this place as my first meal i had.

This famous pho restaurant has been my go-to for the last 20 years, and in all that time, I’ve never had a bad bowl. While it’s become much more popular with tourists in recent years, the quality has remained consistently excellent. The broth is always rich and flavorful, and the meat is perfectly tender. Despite the many great pho places in Saigon, this one still stands out as my favorite. It’s a classic that never disappoints.

Went here multiple times during my stay due to close proximity to hotel. Tried both the pho with meat and pho without meat. Both had rich, flavorful broths; I personally enjoy mine with the provided basil, peppers, lime, bean sprouts and other herbs. Noodles were good as well. Towards my last few visits I switched to no meat — to me, the chicken was a bit chewy. It might look crowded but there are multiple levels with many smaller rooms and seating/tables. They take both card and cash; reasonable prices as well.

address: 72 Đ. Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Amazing place and great food! Visited this restaurant for a light bite and refreshments after sightseeing around the area. It's tucked away in between buildings and at first might be a bit hard to find, but worth the search!

Love the ambience here and service is excellent, special thanks to Than who made sure we were comfortable throughout our visit ✨

We tried the chicken wings as well as the pork belly paus -- loved them both! Definitely would come back here to try the other dishes too. 10/10 🔝

A relaxing atmosphere to dine on weekday nights. The food is delicious and the servers are attentive and helpful. The place is spacious with high ceilings which makes the vibe even more comfortable. 👍

Service was outstanding.  Really very attentive with plenty of staff available.  I ordered one of 5 set lunches on offer - the pork stuffed tofu.  It was very good except for a bit of bone.  Trim your meat properly!  Marked down the food by one star as a result.

Salted coffee was a very yummy as was the Honey Butterfly Pea Iced Tea.

The additions of service charge 5% and VAT (8%) are just a pain… how about all-inclusive pricing as a customer-focused idea?

restaurant_name: Mặn Mòi , Tao Đàn - 34 Võ Văn Tần, Quận 3
address: 34 Võ Văn Tần, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Mặn Mòi is probably the best Vietnamese restaurant I have ever tried. It's pretty simple yet a bit different, but executed to perfection. It's not too sweet like it often is in South Vietnam. Very well-balanced!

The pork was incredible! So good that had you told me it was Pata Negra, I really would have believed you! It was pork cheeks...

The fried fish was simple but all deboned and individually fried for you. Bones are the worst part of eating fried fish in Vietnam. Here, I couldn't stop eating...

Absolutely all the sauces had a little something special that made them exceptionally good!

In short, I was expecting nothing special but came out thoroughly impressed! It's nothing over-the-top but this is what perfection looks like!

I don't know who the executive chef is but bravo!

Stopped by for lunch, after shopping for gift shop at their lower level (same building). We did not make any reservations, but the staff were very informative and friendly about our waiting. The staff spoken in both Vietnamese and English, so this is a plus for tourists and travelers. The menu is a good representation of Vietnamese food. Their food was okay for me, not too great and not bad either. Their prices are in a higher range, which was expected for the location and esthetic. The decoration and architectural were the main reasons for me to visited this place, so I did not expect much about their food and drinks. It’s the small details that made me happy, from their straws to their containers, those small items were very familiar to my memory of Old- Vietnamese (i grew up in the countryside). It’s a good place for people who want to know or experience “Vietnamese” in a tailored way. I may be back for the experience, but not for the food.

Great place to eat and interesting to look at inside/outside. The menu at Man Moi is largely meant to be shared. We ordered five dishes between two people. Loved the young ambarella and fried anchovy salad + wild shrimp simmered in onion sauce. Hot pot was a great way to finish our meal.

restaurant_name: Tartine Saïgon - Bà Huyện Thanh Quan, Q3
address: 14a Bà Huyện Thanh Quan, street, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Absolutely amazing food and coffee!! The staff is so nice and accommodating to our every request, even checking up on us every now and then. Portion sizes are also very generous! Would return here again if we’re back! Highly recommend to get their fermented chili sauce, it is really good ☺️

Occasionally, I must have a full western breakfast.  If you are in a tourist area, you can find many options.  This new place wasn’t around last year, but I was glad I found it this year.  Nice and crusty/airy sourdough bread.  I took a loaf ‘home’, (400g/$2).  I had a full breakfast which in SE Asia usually means a British breakfast: eggs, salad, beans (not for me) sausage, bacon, grilled tomato, and toasted sourdough. Along with a very good Americano, ($9).  I intend to go back for a lox/cream cheese bagel next time.

Coming from Australia, although the coffee in Vietnam is very good we haven’t always loved the milk coffees like lattes and cappuccinos.

This place is exceptionally good.

Perfect lattes, delicious ingredients in all dishes and the best croissants we’ve had on our trip. Staff are lovely and restaurant is clean and pretty.

What a pity it’s our last day!

address: 57 Hồ Xuân Hương, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: The seats in the restaurant are spacious and comfortable, very relaxing, and the dishes are very special, especially the snails. The price is also reasonable, recommended.
I enjoyed the food very much, tasty and full of flavour.

Good food, great service

Really recommend the rolls, they really elevate the rolls experience here

address: 216/4 Đ. Điện Biên Phủ, Phường Võ Thị Sáu, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: HOME Saigon offers amazing Vietnamese food in a warm and welcoming atmosphere, perfect for any occasion – whether you're dining with family, friends, colleagues, or corporate partners. They also cater to group guests. The staff is young, dedicated, and attentive to every request. Thanks to the recommendation from Sales Manager Ms. Victoria, we had a fantastic time and thoroughly enjoyed the food. Highly recommended, and we will definitely be back! 💯💯💯

After a long full day tour, wanted to relax and have something that wasn’t street food. Home fit the bill perfectly! It is located inside an alley, feels serene & tranquil. The live piano & violin added a nice touch. Nicely prepared cocktail and generous portion tasting menu, personal & friendly service made for a perfect day!

**"Exceptional dining experience!"**
I had the pleasure of dining at “Home”last night, and I can't recommend it enough. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, with impeccable service throughout the evening. The staff was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, offering great recommendations.

The food was absolutely outstanding. Every dish was a masterpiece, perfectly seasoned, beautifully presented, and bursting with flavor. The spring rolls was a standout – it exceeded my expectations in every way.

The drinks menu had a wonderful selection of unique cocktails, and the wine pairing suggestions were spot-on. We finished off with a decadent dessert, which was the perfect ending to an already incredible meal.

If you're looking for a top-notch dining experience, “Home” is the place to go. I can't wait to return! It sure make you feel like home!!!

restaurant_name: Nhà Hàng Ăn Uống Sài Gòn 3
address: 9A Tú Xương, Phường Võ Thị Sáu, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: This place is clean, has AC and has dining upstairs. The staff here are great and service is quick. The food is good but it tastes like it was frozen the day before and steamed. Lots of yummy MSG. It’s expensive for the quality, the food is average so don’t expect too much. The fish in the tanks looks dead and I wouldn’t come here again. Stop by and try it out if you’re in the area. They do accept international VISA credit cards here

This is by far one of the best restaurants I’ve been to! The service was outstanding, and the staff made us feel very welcome. The menu offers a great variety of dishes, and everything we ordered was full of flavor. The ambiance is cozy and elegant, making it perfect for both casual meals and special occasions. Highly recommended!
The food is beautifully presented and suits my family's taste. My daughter especially loves eating here. The space is clean and airy. Will recommend to friends.

address: 14/5Bis Đ. Kỳ Đồng, Phường 9, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Authentic Vietnamese chicken glass noodle soup for ages. It’s always crowded but customers don’t have to wait too long to be seated 🫶🏻
Must try the shredded chicken SALAD. It’s the bestttt.
- Very convenient to get to as the location in Dist 3.

I had a wonderful experience here. The staff were friendly, and the chicken pho was unique. The broth was clearer than the usual beef pho soup. The sugar cane drink was refreshing, especially on a hot day.
Quick serving, big portion, and so comforting. Phở gà is flavorful, and leaves you totally satisfied. Perfect for a filling, cheap (but not that cheap), quick, cozy meal.

address: 225/9 Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Phường 5, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 72406, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: A place worth coming to when you want a cozy and quiet vibes for a date. I chose set menu and it was enough for 2 people. Staff are friendly and the food is very well decorated and delicious🥰

Pricey but worth the price. The lamb skewers was amazing. My friend said it's kinda smell but I think it was fine. The pastas that we had were all kind of bland so I had to ask for extra salt and Tabasco.
Dragon fruit and watermelon drink was excellent and fresh!
Passion fruit drink ia not recommended because it was too sour for both of us.
Services was outstanding!

Went here and I was really impressed with the food I ordered. I tried the Volcano pasta and it was really delicious for me. I would definitely come back again specifically for that dish again.

The restaurant had a great romantic vibe to it as well.

address: 254 Bis Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Phường Võ Thị Sáu, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
If you’re looking for authentic Vietnamese cuisine, this restaurant is a must-visit. The food is absolutely delicious—it tastes just like home. From the moment you walk in, you’re greeted with a warm welcome from the owner, making you feel instantly comfortable. The staff are attentive and take care of everything with great care, ensuring a pleasant dining experience.

The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. Every detail, from the ambiance to the menu selection, reflects Vietnamese culture in the best way. The menu is thoughtfully curated, offering a great variety of dishes that truly showcase the richness of Vietnamese cuisine. Highly recommended!

Really really good cooking here, with excellent options for vegetarians. Not far off fine dining. We had the vegetarian pumpkin with rice, Red Tilapia fish with tamarind sauce, and potato wedges. All superb. The vibe of the restaurant is great, lovely decor and good music. The staff were very upbeat and friendly, and apologetic for some slight problems we had during our meal.
We came at a strange time, when they were waiting for several large table bookings. As a result, they were out of quite a few options on the menu, which they didn’t tell us, and several other diners, until after we went to order/had already ordered! This meant there was a delay in timings with the food, and the staff were a bit distracted (from the other/smaller tables) waiting for their arrival, but this is not a major problem and the taste of the food more than made up for it. All in all, a good restaurant with good cooking.

Convenient to our hotel, we had a light dinner and really enjoyed the food. Fresh rice paper rolls, vegetarian spring rolls and Mekong Delta flower salad. Our waitress was so lovely, she has excellent english and really looked after us. Recommend as authentic Vietnamese dishes and very pleasant decor and vibe.

restaurant_name: Street Food - Gà Rán Pizza, Hamburger - Nguyễn Thượng Hiền
address: 216 Nguyễn Thượng Hiền, Phường 4, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: i ordered a spaghetti togo at 11pm, happy with what i got , their fries r very ok too, my new fav spot to dine late night

CHEESE!!! tell the shop not to be sad:

1. The tendon beef burger didn't chew or break. I don't know if it was undercooked or because the beef was old.

2. 38k/beef burger (take away) and ask if you can add cheese? Don't be too greedy for words, everyone will run away.

3. The burger has 1 piece of vegetables, tomatoes, thin slices of beef. I still wouldn't eat it again for 25k, customers expect much more.

The chicken and potatoes are crispier than KFC, the price is cheap, the meat is not too old, in general it is very good for the price. I bought it at 6pm and only saw chicken thighs, so it's even more suitable for people who like thighs like me. There are also pizzas, fish balls sold, and a diverse menu. Take away only due to small space.

address: 29 Ngô Thời Nhiệm, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Dinner at Hoa Túc was a delightful experience, with a beautifully curated 10-course meal featuring traditional Vietnamese dishes. Each course was thoughtfully prepared, showcasing fresh ingredients and authentic flavors. From aromatic soups to flavorful seafood and perfectly balanced herbs and spices, every dish was a treat. The restaurant’s ambiance added to the charm, with a cozy yet elegant setting. Service was attentive, making the entire dining experience smooth and enjoyable. A fantastic spot for those looking to explore Vietnamese cuisine in a refined and memorable way!

y’all… i rarely write harsh reviews but this one? nah. hard pass.
if you’re vietnamese like me, run. if you’re a foreigner looking for solid vietnamese contemporary food? still run.

we walked in (2 pax, bill over 1.5m vnd), and not even a hello while other foreign guests got full red carpet energy with smiles. when we asked politely for a flower and to bring the light back, the staff acted like we were the problem. and don’t even get me started on how little they knew about the menu—cold af.

now the food… yikes. we ordered almost all their “chef’s recs” and it was a mess:
- surf clams with sesame cracker? just salt. zero seafood taste.
- crab & shrimp pomelo salad? shrimp dry, crab barely there (literally counted like 5 tiny pieces).
- sea bass w pineapple sauce? fish not fresh and the sauce combo made zero sense.
- braised pork neck w coconut? ruined my childhood memory of this dish.

dessert? only the coconut ice cream slapped (real coconut vibes, paired w coconut water). but that lil scoop couldn’t save this 1.5mil disaster.

creme brulee with ginger & sticky rice? barely any cream, sticky rice was frozen stiff like it just woke up from the freezer lol.

overpriced, overhyped, underwhelming. would not recommend.

Food was homely and delicious. The braised beef with lemongrass and caramelised pork ribs warmed our hearts. We went for the set lunch at 155K+ which came with rice, main dish, vegetable, soup and a dessert. Exceptionally value for money.

address: 21 Ngô Thời Nhiệm, Phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh 77000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Recommend by a friend. Really great food for the price. That “mom’s kitchen” vibe and flavor. Most surprising was how big the portions were; unmatched cost performance for quality French food. This reinforces my notion that you can always trust recommendations from people from Japan, France, or Texas; haven’t been let down yet.

Good French restaurant with a very good menu. Good atmosphere and decent service, enough for most dates and business meetings over a meal. Decent variety of food and you can call in advance if you want them to prepare something not on the menu for you.
The lunch set is very affordable as you pay only for the main dish (includes drink, starter and dessert). Free parking.
Has some signature french dishes. Friendly staff.

Food looks great, but the quality is just okay. The blue cheese is way too salty, and the sides don’t help. Pickles don’t really go with it either. The onion soup looks nice but has a weird sour taste. The beefsteak is alright, but the sauce is nothing special.

reviews.user_review:
Looking for a taste of Thailand in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City? Look no further than CHADA THAI Restaurants!

From the moment you walk in, the place hits you with a burst of vibrant energy and genuine Thai hospitality. The decor is a killer blend of modern chic and traditional Thai flair that instantly transports you to Bangkok. And the food? Absolutely next-level. Every dish is packed with authentic flavors—from fiery curries that pack a punch to perfectly balanced salads that hit all the right notes. Each bite is a reminder that real Thai cuisine isn't just food; it's an art form.

The service is on point, with a team that's as friendly as they are efficient, always ready to drop some knowledge or help you navigate the menu like a pro. It’s clear they take pride in every detail, making sure your experience is as unforgettable as the food itself.

If you're in HCMC and ready to embark on a culinary adventure that will blow your mind, CHADA THAI Restaurants is your ticket to an extraordinary dining experience. Trust me—this is one spot you don't want to miss!

Not so much authentic Thai flavour.
Pineapple fried rice was served in 'pineapple bowl' instead of pineapple 😄 Mango sticky rice looks nice but was disappointed as the mango was pretty sour & sticky rice don't really tasted Thai. Overall the salad, vegy, meat were tasty in its own way.

Large portions and exceptional Thai flavors give this quaint diner a 5 star rating. Value, taste, freshness all describe the food here. We had tomyum soup with fish, rare pork with Thai lime sauce, mango salad, and my PERSONAL RECOMMENDATION- the sweet and sour pork. We highly recommend this eatery to all our local friends looking to support the small businesses now that there are so many Thai restaurant chains in Saigon.

address: VN Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh Quận 10 Tổ 56-khu4 89d, 70350, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Really enjoyed this food street. There weren't a lot of tourists, and it seemed like it was mostly young locals coming here when we were visited.

Definitely recommend to everyone visiting Ho Chi Minh to come here and try all the street food! We had some grilled seafood, and we were pleasantly surprised that we didn't get any food poisoning at all from any of the stuff that we tried here.

It was a bit hard to order cos some menus only have Vietnamese words, so we weren't entirely sure what we were getting but anyway, it ended up being really enjoyable. Most of the sellers here don't speak any English, so you'll just have to point at things you want.

A local market filled with assorted dishes from local to international cuisine. Everything is very affordable and is great when you want to try different items from different stalls.

I recommend trying the Vietnamese pizza, the grilled squid, fresh oysters, panu puri and the bone marrow.

It's really a spot for locals.

It's a night market food street like any other. I tried horseshoe crab for the first time (probably will be the last, because it was not good - although, I think it was how it was prepared), a coconut smoothie (next to the crab place), two K-style chicken stalls, (what I thought was a regular chicken egg, but don't think it was) seafood mixed with egg in an oyster shell, and avocado ice cream (next to the egg stand). I personally didn't like any of the food. I did want to try a banana crepe I saw on Instagram but couldn't find it.

Overall, it is interesting to see the stuff. It's a tight space, and parts have a distinct odor that smells kind of bad.

For the crab, I envisioned crab meat mixed in with rice or an egg... it was horseshoe caviar mixed with a little egg. I'm not sure if there was any crab meat in it. It would have been 150K/$5.90 for the smallest. I chose 200K/$7.85 for the bigger one, yet there was a "full size adult" one that was twice as big but didn't have a price. The cocnut smoothie (25K/$1) was like any coconut smoothie I've had in Vietnam; good but standard.

The first K-chicken place I saw it and just immediately wanted it, due to my history of eating K-street chicken. It was kind of poor quality chicken, wasn't regular 닭강정 (sweet & spicy sauce), and more expensive than I'd expect (50K/$1.95) but that was the same price as the second K-chicken place. The chicken itself looked much better at the second place, yet the taste was equally poor and instead of 닭강정, it was just mustard tasting and a large amount of skin.

I passed by (maybe they had both anatomies?) what was called "love bread," male part shaped streat bread - didn't try it, though.

The oyster (whatever it was) shell of mixed seafood, sliced hotdog, egg, and cheese look good (20K/$0.80). The same stall was selling garlic bread and balut. I think it was a balut egg because it tasted awful (to me). I was also given a spoon that seemed wiped with tap water, but not actually clean. So I ordered an avocado coconut ice cream (30K/$1.20), thinking he would give me a plastic spoon. I asked for one, but he just grabbed another metal spoon from the same container as the other. When he brought out the ice cream, it did come with a new plastic spoon. The avocado mixed in with the ice cream was sugary goo (that I've had as a smoothie elsewhere), it wasn't great.

To help with the taste of the egg, I bought fresh pomegranate juice (40K$1.55... maybe it was 50K?) on my way out, but that also didn't taste good and was more expensive than I expected.

One street/alleyway over is a flower street market that looks like it has nice flowers.

reviews.user_review:
Although the food was tasty, service was incredibly slow and unattentive even though we were 1 of two parties in the room. One of the seaweed leaf dishes (an appetizer) never came out and by the end of the meal when we asked them to cancel it, the server went back, talk to the chef, and then told us that it would be coming out soon. At that point, we had already finished eating!

My mom asked them point blank why they were forcing us to take a dish when we done eating and our server immediately ran away and got the manager who apologized and took it off our bill. Though, the service became even slower after this.

The best thing about this restaurant was the drinks.

We ordered:
- Tam Cua Lot (Soft Shell Crab Salad) - 4/5
- Com Nep Nam Khao Lao (Khao Lao Rice Balls) - 4/5, the rice was a bit on the dry side, but the beef was perfectly cooked and tender with the right amount of tangy seasoning
- Bo nuong Luang Prabang (Luang Prabang Grilled Beef) - 3/5 beef was overcooked but seasoning was on pint
- Dao suon Khao Lao (Khao Lao Spicy Ribs) - 3/5 also overcooked and there wasn't enough spice
- Com chien dua hai san (Pineapple Fried Rice) - 3/5 serving size was too small and there wasn't enough seasoning in the fried rice
- Xoi nep than (Black Sticky Rice) - 4/5 - perfectly cooked, nice and hot, but could've used just a pinch of salt
- Xoi Lao (Lao Sticky Rice) - 3/5 - perfectly cooked, but its plain (which makes sense since it's just white sticky rice)
- Heo mot nang chien (Deep-fried sun dried pork) - 3/5 a bit over cooked and on the salty side
- Mien Ap Chao Nam (Sauteed glass noodles with mushrooms) - 4/5 nicely seasoned and glass noodles were cooked well, nice and springy
- Apple Hibiscus Tea - 5/5, incredibly aesthetic and tasty! the right amount of tang and sweetness
Best for a dinner for dating or seeking a new flavor of delta Asian. Best dish for me is fish. All fish dish is value to try. Love the fish here.

reviews.user_review:
A top 5 meal we had in Vietnam. The menu is all in Vietnamese so it’s not the most tourist-friendly but the food is scrumptious! Such great dishes using ingredients I’ve never tried before like mango leaf or coconut tree bark.

The betel leaf beef wraps were especially great but everything was good too

Rice paper is relatively chewier than regular ones, and comes with a mountain of a variety of herbs that you can include in your wrap, along with pickled veggies, cucumbers and bean sprouts.

The Bo La Lop is pork wrapped with betel leaves, very juicy and fragrant when combined with crushed peanuts. Pork Cha Gio and Crab Cha Gio both had great crispy texture, but the latter was a little bland. Nem Nuong was moist, savory with a hint of sweetness. Pig Ear and Hock were tender, with the crisp of the cartilage.

The Bamboo Nuoc Mam Salad was also very addicting, a perfect balance of sweet and umami, served with shrimp chips.

For more photos check out @bredgyeats!

reviews.user_review: The Singapore style frog meat in thịck sauce was good, and it's the first time I taste this dish, but to be honest, I can't find it in harmony with rice congee. Maybe it'll be better if it serves with cooked rice instead. Congee isn't necessary.
This restaurant features frog served boiling hot and very tasty rice porridge.

Cháo Ếch Sentosa in Ho Chi Minh City is a unique and must-visit restaurant for frog congee lovers. The restaurant has a cozy and comfortable atmosphere with friendly and attentive staff. The menu offers a variety of frog congee dishes, made with fresh ingredients and cooked to perfection. The congee is flavorful and delicious, and the frog meat is tender and well-seasoned. The restaurant also offers a great selection of drinks to pair with your meal. Prices are reasonable, and portion sizes are generous. Overall, Cháo Ếch Sentosa is a great option for those looking to try something new and delicious in Ho Chi Minh City

address: 460 Đ. Nguyễn Tri Phương, Phường 8, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
OMG!! Hands down the best beef pho I ate in Vietnam. We travelled from North to South sampling the beef and chicken pho plus an obscene amount of other dishes for 19 days.

This one delivered on all fronts, taste, umami, textures and freshness and generosity.
Just a shame we found this one the night before we flew home.
We would've returned again and again if we had more time, did consider trying to fit in a quick bowl before racing for the airport but was time poor 😅

Next time I'm back I'll be visiting again.

This is one of my favorite pho places! I also live very near it. I visit vietnam very often and this is still one of the best bowls of phở nạm gầu. Their satế is very good too. For most vietnamese people, I feel like their pho is a little expensive.

This spot has good tasting Pho broth. However, I don't think it deserves the Michelin certificate. I think there are better Pho restaurants than this in this city.
I like the meat balls. They are good sized balls. A lot of fresh herbs were given as well. Very busy when I came in the morning.
The parking staffs will assist you with parking. Great service!
Overall, great Pho and experience!

reviews.user_review: Vietnamese seafood, all of the seafood was fresh. The value was super awesome, they use a lot of butter with sweet and salty flavor which I find quite interesting and very unique to Vietnamese.

This place is a hidden gem but don't go without locals.
Specialised in seafood, mostly bivalves, the way they cook really emphasised the tastefulness of the ingredients.
But expect many loud heavy drinkers around you and even some beggars.
Menu is complex and can only and should be explained by your local accompanies.
Prices are reasonable.
Little bit pricey but worth it. There are many other alternatives for casual occasions but if you want a bigger shellfish (hint: quality) and better seasoning/flavor then this will be it.

The food is tasty too! A bit pricy in my opinion, I believe the 5 pieces of chicken are already 80 or 90k if I remember correctly, but I guess sometimes quality over quantity makes it worth it!

Recommended!
