address: 500 Đ. Vĩnh Viễn, Phường 8, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Despite the bustling atmosphere during peak hours, with motorbikes lining the street from dine-in and takeout customers, the staff efficiently manages the flow. Just pull over, staff readily assist with seating and taking your orders. Orders are swiftly prepared and offered at reasonable prices. However, the high volume can compromise food quality. To expedite service, large batches of dumplings are steamed, that may not ensure thorough cooking for all varieties. As a result, the served dumplings can sometimes be cold, and the wrappers might lack the desired elasticity.

Very delicious Dimsum and Shumai at a very authentic street food place. It can get quite chaotic as it's a popular local place but the order comes quick and the owners are handling it quite well. The prices are great and my favorite dish was the scallops dimsum.
My favorite spot.  I lived nearby and the family always greeted me with a smile.  They are crazy busy at night so be patient.  It's delicious and the atmosphere is fun.

address: 391/6 Đ. Sư Vạn Hạnh, P.12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Affordable place with friendly staff. I had the asparagus wrapped in beef with a fried egg, and it tasted great. It came with a delightful baguette and a small salad, which made for an excellent meal. You might miss it if you don't notice the sign. Take the stairs up and you'll be there.

Had their couple offer which included 2x beefsteaks, 2 salads of your choice, small portion of fries, 2 banh mi's and two drinks of your choice for 249k. Beef was delicious and tender, however it was a very small portion, coupled with a lot of garlic. I love garlic but even this was a bit too much, there was dried garlic on the salads too. Fried were very oily and the banh mi's were ok, but nothing special. Would come back if sround if the beef portion was bigger.
Very good service, tasty food and as always bread is superb. However, steak was made well done, which brings the overall quality down a little bit.

address: 226 Đ. Nguyễn Tri Phương, Phường 4, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Good service, good food, salad and side dishes were free flow, so the whole meal was really filling!
Bit expensive than other branches
Ok .

restaurant_name: Hủ tiếu Thái Lan Pi Thai
address: 802 Đ. Sư Vạn Hạnh, Phường 12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh 72510, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
The food is nice. Thai Tom Yum is decent,  the boilded eggs were a nice touch.
The price is so-so, but it is a little too cozy to bring your family of 4 or your girlfriend with you.
No car parking, but you can still park it at the Van Hanh Mall and take small walk acrossing the street.
Very delicious noodles with great texture. Definitely recommended. I’ll be back for sure.
First try a Thai-style rice noodle in HCMC – delicious and reasonably priced!

restaurant_name: Mì Ốc Hến Dì Lan Q10
address: 1 Cư Xá Đồng Tiến, Phường 14, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
My very first time enjoy this noodle with clam and baby octopus. The taste was sweet from the clam (?) or coconut water.

But so nice and fresh with tamarind dipping sauce. One portion around 37.000 vnd without drink.

Portion fair enough, not too big. One of should come when visit HCM.

This kind of food just appeared recently in Hochiminh city.
I tried and pretty liked it.
Although it's definitely not a kind of healthy meal but it's delicious.
Should save it incase you'll need something good to eat.
It has 2 addresses in district 4 and 10. You can look it up on Google Maps easily.
Thanks.
The top of pictures is very good. It's like a seafood noodles

address: 503 Đ. Sư Vạn Hạnh, Phường 12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
I was surprised this restaurant has thousands of 5 stars reviews then figured out customers have given good reviews for a free desert. But I decided to try because it’s close to our place. If you eat for the first time, you might like it. However, it wasn’t as good as other places that I tried and the price is expensive for this taste. The fish was dried and plain, it didn’t have signature smell that it should have.
I normally don’t give the reviews for the restaurant in Vietnam as you have so many options here, I just feel this is unfair when this restaurant has bribed customers for the good reviews.
Try their signature: cha ca La Vong. It is good place to try Northern food in Saigon 🙂🙂🙂
Amazing food, friendly atmosphere, and a tea that is unique and refreshing. My first time to try chả cá and I loved it. Highly recommend!

address: 382/47 Đ. Lê Hồng Phong, Phường 1, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: N/A

address: 11 Đ. Sư Vạn Hạnh, Phường 12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh 720000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
A Fantastic Vietnam Buffet Experience!

Its always HY buffet every time in HCMC! The variety of dishes offered was impressive, featuring an authentic spread of Vietnamese cuisine, from fresh spring rolls to delicious grilled meats and seafood.

The highlight for me was the seafood station, and I could customize it with my preferred toppings. The steam fish was another standout—soft on the inside, and filled with well-seasoned ingredients. The selection of dipping sauces, perfectly complemented the dishes.

The ambiance was warm and inviting, with a touch of Vietnamese charm in the decor. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring that everything was replenished and that guests had a great dining experience.

To top it off, the dessert section featured an array of traditional Vietnamese delicacies, making for a perfect ending to a fantastic meal.

Overall, this buffet is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic Vietnamese flavors. The combination of fresh ingredients, great variety, and excellent service makes it well worth the visit!

The restaurant is always crowded, whether on weekdays or weekends. My family went on a Tuesday at noon, and all the tables were full, with the food coming out slowly because of the number of customers. We all ate our fill, and it only cost about 200k per person.

The Vietnamese food and desserts at Hoang Yen are very good, but the Western dishes are not very special in my opinion. The best dish I’ve had there is the banh can, which I recommend everyone try.
Restaurant just beside the buffet (also under hoang yen group) serves good food.

address: 382 Đ. Nguyễn Tri Phương, Phường 4, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Chè Thái Ý Phương is a popular spot for those craving a refreshing dessert. The sweet soup here is delicious, affordable, and visually appealing, making it an attractive choice for sweet treat lovers. However, one minor drawback is that the durian portion is quite small, which might disappoint durian enthusiasts. Overall, it’s still a great place to enjoy tasty sweet soup at a reasonable price.
The che Thai and Bahn flan were so delicious. The iced desserts are perfectly balanced and great for a sweet treat. Definitely recommend.

Tried their Thai tea (without durian) and it was good. They have an inside area as well as a ptio with lower chairs. Prices are ok considering the location. Can recommend if you are craving some cooling desserts. A plus for not charging for Vietnamese tea (tra da) as well as wet napkins.

address: 760 Đ. Sư Vạn Hạnh, Phường 12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Nice staff.

Taste is ok but not good.

Low service

Need improve your services

Been here couple of times, delicious hot food, beef dishes are pretty nice unlike chicken which doesn't meet my expectation.

If you're coming here for dinner, parking might cost you a bit during crowded hours.

It's hot in here due to the unique kind of food serving they are delivering.
Good place for a quick meal and couple chat.

address: 436A/63 Đ. 3 Tháng 2, Phường 12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
- I went and the two people who arrived first were already sitting at the table. A new customer also came in and asked me to move to another table (?). The table in the house is high. We were asked to sit at a table facing the glass, but outside it was a low table. The customer was sitting at a low table outside and I looked in and... it hit me right in the face.
- When ordering, the staff did not listen, stood talking and dialing the phone. When I came out, my attitude was very unpleasant.
- After that, we told them to stop taking it away, but we couldn't sit there so rudely. Then wait 40 minutes for food
… That's Ohhhhhh Styleeee :)))))

The food is okay, the price is cheap, the dough layer is thick, the spices are strong, and once in a while it's delicious but not boring. Waiting for food is too long. Every time I come to eat, I have to wait 40-60 minutes. Not to mention 10 times, 9 times the table is sold out. Sometimes when I go out and want to eat at the restaurant, it's difficult. The restaurant's customer base is probably take-away customers.

The restaurant is delicious, has a long-standing reputation in Singapore but the prices are reasonable so it's quite crowded, plus the space is quite small so the wait for the food is a bit long. Maybe that's why you rate the restaurant a bit low. For me, the restaurant is very good, plus there is a chef who is a bit skinny, but quite good-natured, the type of person who immediately falls in love with you when you meet him. Don't give the restaurant 1 star because of that. Every time I have a chance to visit District 10, I stop by this shop

address: 297f Tổ 42, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Good market place to walk abou, explore the place. Plenty of flower shop, if your into flowers. Food is great too along the street.
The food was amazing, it is really cheap and a must go if you are close by. It should be eaten with beer but is fine without it. It is in the Cambodian market.
Amazing food and the host is super super nice and accommodating - a must visit if you're in the area

address: 732 Đ. Sư Vạn Hạnh, Phường 12, Quận 10, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: If you are looking for a quick meal, this is a good place. The foods are ok with good price. However, the taste can be better. The place is a bit tight, and the seats are not comfortable. Staffs need a better training. Overall, it is ok. Thank you.

I tasted bún chả giò in Mộc Vị and others dish like fried rice, fried chicken and chicken finger salad. Actually the dishes are not very excellent but it's fine. The topings like fried spring roll, fried chicken are hot so it's quite good.

A culinary masterpiece that brings together a delightful array of flavors and textures. The fresh shrimp, fragrant herbs, and crunchy peanuts over turmeric noodles create a dish that is as visually stunning as it is delectable

restaurant_name: KissTour (SaigonKissTours) - Motorbike City & Food Tour with 100% Female Drivers
address: 225 Đ. Nguyễn Xí, P. 13, Bình Thạnh, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
I booked a private Tour. The very charming tour guide Ly picked me up at time at the hotel. The route leads through different districts in a sometimes heavy traffic. Don't miss the given information. Don't be scared. Ly is an experienced and careful driver.
She can give you a lot of information.
I enjoyed the food and the very charming and entertaining style.
The best compliment: anytime again.
Thank you Ly

What an amazing evening out we had with Keidy and Esther. It is early in our holiday to Vietnam but we are sure our food tour will be a massive highlight. Having never been on a motorcycle before I was a little nervous but Esther was incredibly thoughtful and kind. Keidy and Esther’s knowledge is brilliant and we learned such a lot as well as tasting delicious food and reaching parts of the city we wouldn’t have seen. We cannot recommend them and Kiss Tours highly enough! Thank you so much

I had a private tour with Fidelia and she was amazing. Super friendly, confident on the motorbike in traffic and knowledgeable about the city’s history. The tour was a cross section through the city’s culture. From the old post office, to a Buddhist Monument, to a literal bunker, and finally Chinatown, all while being guided and educated about the different places. The food was delicious but the conversation and personality of Fidelia really made the day. Thank you so much.

restaurant_name: Mặn Mòi, Thảo Điền - 32 Đường 11, Quận 2
address: 32 Đ. Số 11, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: The cozy Vietnamese inspired atmosphere and thoughtfully designed interior make this place well worth a visit. The service is just as impressive our server was not only friendly but also well-trained, offering great recommendations and ensuring everything arrived promptly. As for the food, while it leans on the pricier side, the beautiful plating and authentic flavors make it a satisfying experience.

Man Moi is an exemplary restaurant showcasing the creativity of Vietnamese cuisine and culture. I’ve never seen Vietnamese food presented as fine dining or tasted any of the dishes here before, and this restaurant expanded my knowledge of food. Every dish was delicious and beautifully presented - the menu is pretty extensive, so you can see that a lot of heart and work went into this restaurant.

The restaurant is beautifully and mindfully decorated. Also thank you so much to Ngan, for the best service we received in Vietnam. She gave us amazing recommendations (especially the amazing dessert selection) and was so friendly.

Definitely a highlight during our trip to Vietnam.

Love the whole ambience. Its actually linked to the vegetarian restaurant and a retail store, Bloom, selling local goods. The food was very delicious. Ordered the sour catfish soup which has an interesting zesty and refreshing taste to it. The grilled chicken in panda. Wrap was along with the sweet chili sauce with it was another key highlight. Staff where all friendly such as Trang Dang that helped me with my queries at the retail store.

address: 23 Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Came here for lunch as my husband have been here before. Server Dinh was an absolute angel, asking the kitchen if they cam accommodate my request to not include dairy with my order. Food was great. Ordered the falafel and the veggie burger. Love the atmosphere here as well. Perfectly pressed table napkins for the 5 stars!

Food: Mekong offers both regular and vegan/vegetarian options for diners. The portions are large, catering well to foreigners, and the taste is quite good. Rating: 4/5.

Service: Similar to The Deck, the staff at Mekong are nice, friendly, and professional, with similar uniforms and ages.

Atmosphere: The venue is very spacious, featuring both indoor and outdoor areas, creating a relaxed and chill ambiance.

Food is nice, not salty which is good for kids. Vegetarian friendly and kids friendly.
Pizza is crispy and good; has 2 sizes to choose from, which is good unlike other restaurants which only come in 1 (big) size.
Good and wide selection of drinks. Has a play area for children.
Has both outdoor and indoor seating with nice decorations.

address: 16/9 Nguyễn Văn Hưởng, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Great location, but I wasn't really impressed with either the food or the service. Their french fries are bad! Sitting outside was pleasant with a nice view, but it was difficult to get the servers to bring me anything. The inside is very hot and humid, and I didn't want to stay in the very long.

Easygoing, a variety of options, and great food at Chang’s Bistro—definitely worth the money!

A must-try: the Black Lychee Tea. It’s absolutely delicious!
Ambiance and staff are nice. Food wise is so-so as taste not worth the price.  Menu is a bit confusing for me

address: 41 Thảo Điền, Quận 2, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Grocery with many imported goods, very comfortable location, you feel premium and pay premium. Still interesting for many as it is nice shop and not so many people

The most comfortable and complete supermarket I went to during 3 weeks trip in Vietnam. If you are looking for western snacks, chocolate, skin care, this is the place I would first look to in HCMC. The cafe on the second floor is a gem! Too bad I didn’t have time to try their buffet package. Will come back!

I recently visited Annam Gourmet and was blown away by the incredible selection of high-quality products. From fresh produce to cheeses, chocolates, and wines, Annam Gourmet has it all. The store is beautiful and everything is clearly labeled and easy to find. The staff were friendly and offering helpful recommendations. The prices were high but reasonable for the exceptional quality of the products. The eating is cool and suitable for meetings with friends and partners

address: 47 Đ. Xuân Thủy, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Wow, I was really surprised to have a place like this in Ho Chi Minh City. It's not a waste of five stars in price, taste, and service. Modern, black-and-white color, beautiful interior design, delicious food, cheap food, and luxurious taste. In the evening, the quality of food comparable to that of a five-star hotel, beautiful lighting and mysterious atmosphere are combined to feel a comfortable atmosphere. It's hard to say, so come and experience it yourself.

Yum as always!
The cheeseburger is fantastic as always and had the roasted sugarcane juice which is just next level deliciousness. Had the Wildside Hard Soda which was a little in the sweet side, but nothing a few cubes of ice couldn't fix.

If you’re in Saigon and craving a top-tier Western BBQ experience, look no further than Ut Ut. This gem brings a slice of authentic American BBQ to the heart of the city with a flawless blend of tradition and innovation.

From the moment you step in, you're greeted by a warm, inviting atmosphere that perfectly complements the mouthwatering aroma wafting from the kitchen. The restaurant’s design marries rustic charm with modern elegance, creating a comfortable yet upscale dining environment.

The menu is a meat lover’s dream. The ribs are tender and fall-off-the-bone delicious, glazed with a smoky, tangy sauce that strikes a perfect balance. The brisket is equally impressive, with a rich, deep flavor that speaks to hours of slow cooking and meticulous preparation. The sides are a highlight in their own right—crispy, golden fries, creamy coleslaw, and baked beans that could easily steal the spotlight.

What truly sets [Restaurant Name] apart is its attention to detail. Each dish is presented with artistry, and the service is impeccable. The staff is knowledgeable, attentive, and genuinely enthusiastic about the food they serve, adding an extra layer of enjoyment to the meal.

Whether you’re a BBQ aficionado or just someone looking for a remarkable dining experience, [Restaurant Name] delivers on every front. It’s a place where every bite feels like a celebration of flavors and craftsmanship. Don’t miss out on this extraordinary culinary destination in Saigon.

address: 84 Đ. Xuân Thủy, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Came here on a Friday night for date night without a reservation! Put ourselves on the waitlist and went to have a drink down the street until it was ready. There was so much on the menu we wanted to order so it took us a bit to narrow down our final order. We went with 2pc Al pastor pork tacos, 2 pc chicken tinga tacos, a gringa quesadilla, a carne asada steak taco, and roasted salsa.

We definitely over ordered but the food was so good! So so so much better than Taco Del Sol - more expensive as well but I feel like I’m actually getting my money’s worth! The quesadilla was my favorite, so good and so flavorful.

We will definitely be back.

please do order the chips, and the churros!!!! super good !!!!!

their event team is also pretty professional!

I think they are the best mexican food in Thao Dien.

I recently visited a lively this restaurant with a vibrant atmosphere. The food was delicious, offering a variety of authentic dishes. One standout feature was their diverse drink menu, which complemented the meals perfectly. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, offering great suggestions based on my preferences. What I loved most was the homemade chili sauces with different levels of spiciness, allowing everyone to find their perfect heat. Whether you're a fan of mild or extra hot, they have something for you. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I can't wait to return!

address: 38 Nguyễn Ư Dĩ, Thảo Điền, Quận 2, Hồ Chí Minh 10000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Perfect setting for a sunset dinner - top bad the sun was behind clouds mostly. Very peaceful and chilled - definitely a well needed break from the busy streets of District 1. Can't fault the service at all. Food was beautifully presented and quality flavours. There was an area for an event but you wouldn't even have noticed it. Asked for a riverside table!

This is a high-end riverside restaurant with a modern and minimalist interior that complements a casual dress code. Set against a serene riverside backdrop, the wooden deck allows diners to enjoy the rhythmic flow of the water right beneath their feet. The restaurant boasts a premium price point, but the food is rather ordinary for the cost. Service quality is moderate, offering a level of attentiveness that feels somewhat average. In Ho Chi Minh City, there are numerous restaurants at this price range offering superior service.

Would I recommend it? Perhaps once or twice to impress a romantic partner or to experience the ambiance alone, as a novelty. However, it is not a place I would suggest frequenting for the food or service.
좋은 시간 갖으세요!

The restaurant is quite big and has a panoramic riverside front, but when it gets dark, you cannot really see anything on the river and it is mostly dark forests on the opposite side. Lighting is dim in the restaurant, so overall it is a dating spot. Food has much room for improvement. Ordered the set dinner so tasted at least 8 dishes but none was memorable. Probably can cook some of these dishes better at home. More of an ambience or drinking place rather than for good food.

address: 56 Đ. Xuân Thủy, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: One of the best Pho places in District 2. Good air conditioned local dining, displaying Saigon's style taste in Pho. 😊

The pho does not have a particularly distinctive flavour, but it is just the right taste for my husband and me. Considering the location and the air-conditioned environment, the price is very reasonable. When eating, mix their two sauces (hoisin and chilli) and dip the meat into them, which is absolutely delicious. What I appreciate is that they serve small bowls, perfect for people like me who are used to eating smaller portions, and there is a wide variety of cuts of meat to choose from. The staff are a bit unfriendly, which is probably the only downside. Otherwise, everything is satisfactory enough to encourage me to return many times.
One of the most Pho restaurant in HCMC. Reasonable prices and comfortable service will make your day.

address: 30 Tống Hữu Định, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Pendolasco in Thao Dien is a charming Italian restaurant tucked away in a peaceful, green corner of Ho Chi Minh City—perfect for both intimate meals and casual group gatherings. We had lunch here for my farewell gathering and opted for their lunch set menu, which was a pleasant surprise: well-balanced, flavorful, and satisfying. The meal was perfectly complemented by a smooth glass of red wine, adding to the relaxed and cozy vibe.

Known for its wood-fired pizzas, handmade pastas, and extensive wine selection, Pendolasco lives up to its reputation. The service was friendly and attentive, making us feel welcome from start to finish. A great spot for anyone craving an authentic Italian experience in the heart of Thao Dien.

✅ Pros:
1. By far the most authentic italian restaurant i've ever tried! Like literally same taste as the ones in Europe!
2. Cozy ambiance!
3. Staffs are very attentive!

❌ Cons:
1. N/A

Rating: 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Remarks:
Our waiter is beyond helpful! I forgot to get his name but he really has a charming smile! He even let me lend his powerbank for my phone!
The food is crazy amazing! Perfect sauce. Perfect seasoning. Salivating handmade dough and pasta. Everything is just amazing and worth its value! Even now I can't forget about it and I'm salivating as I'm reviewing this. Will definitely come back again and recommend to friends!

In fact, I bumped into a good friend and with his kid. The fact that a European finds this also amazing then it's REALLY authentic.

Just full of positive energy and good to catch up with friends.

You have 3 options to choose from where to dine depending on your current vibe. There's one wherein you could see the garden. There's one in garden (al fresco) and there's one that has an old charm vibe.

It has an old charm (yet clean) vibe. Garden-esque. It just goes all together.
Good pizza. I would prefer a "drier" crustier dough in the center part of the pizza ... Beautiful setting. Nice outdoor and indoor space.

address: 39 Trần Ngọc Diện, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
I just had the chance to visit the best authentic French restaurant in Vietnam for the second time, and I have to say - it's truly something special.
The first time I dined here for dinner, I was blown away by the incredible flavors and attention to detail. This time, I decided to stop in for lunch, and the experience was just as remarkable.
The food is so incredibly tasty and really captures the essence of classic French cuisine. As a tourist, I consider it excellent value for money - the quality is top-notch, and the prices are very reasonable.
I'll definitely be returning again❤❤❤

Beautiful fine dining experience!
Absolutely wonderful experience mum and I spent at the 3G Trois. Friendly staff and really felt took good care of throughout. Food at high quality from freshly baked bread rolls and a mouthful size truffle scrambled egg were a yummy start. Entree and main course has so many options to choose from, plus 6 types of cheese platter and desserts… you will be so full by the end. For cost only US$60per person for 5 courses for a French dinner at this quality which is very reasonable. Highly recommended and for sure I will go again if I get a chance to visit HCMC next time.

This place is super underrated! Went on a Friday night and it was pretty quiet. Came here to celebrate my boyfriend’s birthday and the service was impeccable! I really loved the appetisers as well. Had a 7 course meal each which was quite filling! By the time they served the cheese (which is the second last course) I was already full. The aged cheese was too strong for our Asian palate but we enjoyed the cream cheese (reminded us of tofu lol). They also gave us a complimentary birthday dessert.

Staff was lovely and attentive.

Best dishes: egg truffle, raw and smoked tuna, scallops, lemon sorbet, beef fillet, raspberry millefeuille

address: 32 Đ. Nguyễn Duy Hiệu, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Not exaggerating but when I first tried here, thought it was probably the best taco place in town, even compared to all the other places I tried in District1. Wish I took better pics, but yeah everything we tried was all so good.
Nothing stood out for us. The food was too salty and the tortilla not well cooked. I did enjoy the spicy mango Margarita. Service was excellent and the atmosphere is nice.

I got 3 tacos. They were all very tasty and full of flavor. I also got chips and salsa and was pleasantly surprised that they came warm. Bonus point for the fact that chips and salsa are free on Sundays. I'll be back.

address: 10 Đường số 49B, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Stewed beef was exceptional. Tender and juicy shin. Highly recommended.
Wonderful coldbrew coffer!! 💖☕️
The food is very delicious, delicious, and the price is suitable for the portion.

address: Address: 19 Đ. Trần Ngọc Diện, Thảo Điền, Quận 2, 19 Trần Ngọc Diện, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Box Ơi impressed me from start to finish. From the attentive staffs, fast service to their perfectly curated recipes. I’ll simply come back for their delicious sweet tamarind chutney that goes with everything.

Wonderful cake!
I loved this vegan and gluten-free chocolate cake! It’s was super moist, great chocolate flavour and not too heavy.
Will try other things soon!

I had the pleasure of trying the Thai bowl (chicken) at Box Oi, and it was a fantastic experience! The dish was beautifully presented, vibrant with fresh vegetables, and perfectly cooked rice & chicken.
The balance of flavors was spot on — everything blended seamlessly. The peanut sauce was rich and flavorful without being too overpowering.

The portion size was generous, making it great value for the price.

address: 215B4 Nguyễn Văn Hưởng, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 71300, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
The food overall seemed to be good .

However , the Chicken hot pot (Lẩu Gà Lá É), was way way too sweet in my opinion. The restaurant went over the top with sugar. When you visit the middle of Vietnam , where this dish originated , it is hot this sweet . The sweetness added to for the southern tastes, who prefer things sweet

We visited during the day , it was very clean inside the air conditioned room .  The staff were very fast and attentive.

Good security for taking care of the car too

Great place to have chicken hotpot with lá é. The hotpot soup has very special umami flavor that I haven’t tasted anywhere else. Highly recommend! The outside area is also pretty nice. They have amazing background music, big plus :)
The food is okay. When I told the staff there were 3 rats running into the kitchen, they laughed and did nothing.

address: 10 Trần Ngọc Diện, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Madame Lam isn’t on the Michelin Select list by chance—it’s earned its spot. The decor strikes the perfect balance between modern elegance and Vietnamese charm, managing to feel upscale without tipping into gaudiness.

Every dish we tried was a hit. The pomelo salad, beautifully served in a carved-out dragon fruit, was as refreshing as it was eye-catching. The beef cubes were juicy and perfectly paired with chunks of mango, which brought a lovely contrast of sweetness and acidity. The pork jowl with braised cabbage was another standout—the tender cabbage paired beautifully with the rich, flavorful pork.

Portion sizes were generous for the price, making it great value for the quality. Madame Lam is definitely a solid choice if you’re hosting visitors who want a refined taste of Vietnamese cuisine.

This restaurant serves excellent Vietnamese cuisine with a unique twist. Everything we ordered was delicious, and the beef-mango dish exceeded our expectations, along with the stir-fried vegetables and claypot rice. I highly recommend this place. Good value for money too.

We had a fantastic dining experience at Madame Lam, a Michelin-selected restaurant that truly lives up to its reputation. We tried the chicken wings, fried rice with seafood, and a salad with jellyfish, and each dish impressed us with its flavors and presentation. The standout for us was the salad, which had a unique and refreshing taste.

To complement our meal, we also ordered a tea, which had a distinct and memorable flavor. As a delightful surprise, the restaurant gifted us a dessert—ice cream, which was incredibly tasty and the perfect way to end the meal.

Overall, the combination of excellent food, thoughtful service, and a warm atmosphere makes Madame Lam a must-visit. Highly recommended!

address: 6/1/2 Nguyễn Ư Dĩ, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Great little spot with an open terrace, green organic decor, and great food. Can’t remember what it was called but I ordered the Vietnamese dish among a mainly western oriented menu and it was just perfect! Great waiting staff with fluid communication and good English skills! Thank you for having me🙏🏼

The vibe of the restaurant was great, and the staff were super friendly. We went on a Thursday evening, and there was practically no one there so it was very quiet and nice. The food was good, I particularly enjoyed the scallops and oysters (on Thursday evenings they have a sea food promotion where it’s a bit cheaper). We were sad to hear that they would be closing at the end of the month! Definitely would recommend going at least once before they close.

We’ve been to MAD House many times but today was the first time for their Sunday brunch. They had a “roast” which as an American I would call a bbq but it was delicious. They had beef, chicken and a sausage. The chicken was amazing and the other two were good. You can make multiple trips up to the bbq to get seconds. They also serve you a salad, potatoes and some grilled cabbage that was great along with a few sauces for the meats. This is about $25 which I thought was reasonable. Today the weather was great to sit outside and they had live music which was a good band playing songs in Spanish. Would highly recommend MAD House.

address: 97b Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
After trying tapas at places like Octo and Tomattito, I decided to give Lubu a try. Unfortunately, the journey from District 7 to District 1 wasn't quite worth the hour-long trip.

The meal began with crispy cuttlefish accompanied by what was described as a watermelon salad. While the cuttlefish was acceptable, the "salad" was disappointingly simple - just melon chunks and mint leaves with an overly sweet dressing that overwhelmed rather than complemented the dish.

Next came pita bread with carrots and chutney hummus. The pita was noticeably undercooked, and the hummus was entirely forgettable - nothing that would make me want to order it again.

The main course of braised lamb shanks was particularly disappointing. The kitchen had failed to trim the fat properly before braising, resulting in an unpleasant texture and appearance that could have been easily avoided with proper preparation.  The sauce and accompanied rice did not add any value to the fatty lamb.

Despite the mediocre food, the service was a bright spot. The staff were attentive and responsive throughout the meal. One quirk worth mentioning was the place setting - exactly two identical sets of first-course knives and forks arranged on a napkin to the left. When I inquired about this, the waitress explained that unless I ordered steak (which would require a steak knife), this standard setting was considered sufficient.

Overall, Lubu falls short of the standard set by other tapas establishments in the area. While the service was commendable, the food quality doesn't justify the travel time or expense. There are certainly better options available for tapas enthusiasts in the city.
The food is pretty decent and the restaurant is quiet and beautiful, recommend people who like a good dinner with friends.

Had a very enjoyable Mediterranean tapas style Sunday lunch.  Attentive service and fresh well plated food - great options for the non-meat eaters.  A comprehensive wine list with a good selection of  wine by the glass available.  Aperol Spritz definitely worth the 2 for 1 price to finish off the afternoon.  Light and airy vibe restaurant - a great place to escape the hustle bustle of HCMC.  Will definitely visit again!

address: 14 Ngô Quang Huy, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: I came here for lunch yesterday, a party of two. It was an extraordinary experience highly recommend to anyone that visit Vietnam! I’ve been to this restaurant several times, I’ve never been disappointed. The food was delicious and overall great atmosphere with over the top taste! A 10/10 meal! Will come back soon!

An exceptional experience. The ambience feels like you've stepped into a classy French restaurant in Paris.

The staff are very attentive and observant.

For the piece de resistance, the meal is one of the best French dinners I've had. The meats are perfectly cooked. The sauces are so well prepared, glossy and sufficiently assertive without being overwhelming. The ratatouille (served with the Patagonia Tooth Fish) was melting, but still had a bit of structure to give an added dimension to the dish.

We will be back (probably during every visit to HCM).

It was one of my best culinary experiences ever! The atmosphere and the place were absolutely beautiful. I enjoyed everything of the food and loved the selection of wines! Especially the pigeon and the cheese plate were really stunning!
The chef Thierry Mounon is a real artist and I definitely come back!

restaurant_name: Stoker Woodfired Grill & Bar - Thao Dien
address: 2 Đặng Hữu Phổ, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 71107, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Visited for a business lunch — appetizers were tasty and well-prepared, but the fish and meat dishes didn’t quite hit the mark. Overall, a decent experience. 4 stars.

The ambience was just good: spacious yet with light music, a good place for small intimate gathering. Not to mention their food is good, I was quite surprised their cheese platter and sausages were nicely presented and were very delicious. Mains were great too, we ordered Iberico pork and Angus sirloin, but we agreed the pork was better (that doesn't mean the sirloin was not good tho).
The only mar is their dessert menu is not so attractive..... What a pity.

We used to come here for our date nights every 3-6 months and this time it was a pretty bad experience.

Steak had far too much fat and was dry. Quality of wine was underwhelming (and after checking the reviews on Vivino we saw its a 3* rated red wine) accompanied by a group of 10 men drinking whiskey and shouting in Vietnamese.

We shared the qualitative feedback both on the loud sound and the quality of the food with the manager and both were not handled nor addressed.

For a dinner that costs close to 5m, I would expect much better customer service and food quality.

address: 94 Đ. Xuân Thủy, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
An absolute 10 out of 10 for food taste

✅ Great food and ambience, prime location, quick service
⛔️ Street too narrow for car parking
⛔️ Not accessible for wheelchairs. Stairs only.

We came in a group of 5 and sit on a table outdoor. They have a small outdoor space with like 3-4 tables. Might have mosquitoes at night.

Staff and service was quick and helpful. Menu is straightforward and easy to order. There’s no gimmick or upsale here.

Food was the superstar for this place. Great taste. Big portion. Well made. A bit pricey but I think reasonable for this prime location.

Surroundings are lots of cafeshop. The entire street can be a one stop hang out night.

Delicious all the meat!!!
And also the dessert!

Very good service… Thao was very kind with us!

We came yesterday to have a steak and it's awesome !!!
Gotta come back next week. Nice service and food yah !!!

address: Street 39/No 1 Ward, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Beautiful interior, delicious authentic food, but I’d like to say a huge thank you to the staff members who made my birthday celebration vey special! They were not notified beforehand about it, but elevated the whole dinner experience by their extra effort - not only complimentary drinks and dishes, but the attitude amounted to the friendly and cozy ambiance we could enjoy!
Highly recommend both for special events and casual meals - it’s worth it!

Environment and service is good. The only thing that let me down was I try to order 3 or 4 dishes that I would like to eat , and the restaurant couldn't make it because they somehow ran out of ingredients. So overall environment great , service good, food mediocre.

I had dinner with friends here and the food was delicious. We had white wine and red wine to go with the food and both of which was very nice as well. The space and atmosphere was calm and private and all the waitresses were friendly and attentive.

address: Tòa nhà Q2, SH3, SH4, SH5, SH6, 21 Võ Trường Toản, An Phú, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 71107, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Breakfast is ok - but the service needs more training!
Coffee doesn’t have sugar beside.
Served soft boiled eggs are overcooked and needed to be made again. ( annoying waiting time )
Also they served without spoon …
No salt & pepper on table ( but I did collect by myself from other table. )
Toast is way too hard !
Orange juice was a bit bitter so I know it wasn’t fresh made .

We came for the brunch and ordered an English breakfast and a club sandwich. Both were not tasty at all. The staff was unfriendly and not easy to find to ask for payment and other... High price but clearly lower quality than a simple vietnamese food. 1st try last try...

Amazing grocery with wonderful staff! They have great selection of food and drink with amazing pastries and bread to choose from. We also choose to have breakfast here as they also operate as a restaurant which pleasantly surprised food was fantastic as well as service highly recommend coming here. Staff are fantastic.

address: 21 Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
We sometimes stop by to pick up some cool stuff, they have a very interesting selection of items, tho not extensive, there’s some very exclusive imported items that you can’t find anywhere else. If you have some time to browse, stop by to look at their stuff, you just might find something to buy.
However, their items are on the higher end, so it would be expensive, but it’s probably worth it. 💸
Has almost everything we need. Staff are very helpful.

If you are looking to get fresh and clean produce/fruits then you’d really like this place (they have a walk-in fridge where you can find vegetables) They have a wide variety of healthy products that are very hard to find in local Vietnamese groceries and foreign snacks and packaged goods. Very pricey but you can find a lot of healthy choices here that are hard to find at other places! They have pretty much everything you would need. Staff are nice and helpful.

address: 32 Trần Ngọc Diện, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
I didn't get the name of our server but he was a young Vietnamese man with black glasses working Sunday brunch on March 2nd. He gets an A+++++. Kept me so well informed about the details of our meal because we ordered all vegan. He asked us if it was ok to use oil that was used to cook meats to speed up the time we got our order but then told us new oil would be used to cook everything. He was hustling all day long.

I was a bit confused when I arrived because I didn't know if I was at the right restaurant. I was told to go to the "other" area because they still had seats out there. I guess it's first come first served. The outer tables get quite sunny so best to come before 10am on weekends to get a good table.

Vegan options were decent but a bit oily for us. It's not health food though. It's comfort food so that's expected. Portion size is good.

Great place to bring kids

Haven't been here for over a decade, ever since my daughter grew out of her kindergarden years. Snap Cafe has a very pleasant neighbourhood hang-out vibe, and consists of small shops, a playground, and a very casual bistro with friendly service by what seem to be students. Their Caesar Salad was easily the biggest one I have ever seen ... enough for 2-3 people. Illy coffee and an ice cream booth completes the picture.

Great place for kids to run around, the sand pit play ground was a lot of fun. There’s also some shopping!

Food wise, the deep fried rolls were very nice! Then we had a Thai style fried flat rice noodle (chow gai kew), it’s quite salty and but not much flavours. Kids mini slider  and Mexican taco, not great, but it didn’t stop them wanting to go back!

address: 10 Nguyễn Bá Lân, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: I came here out of a whim to try something new. Had the cod fish and chip and a can of Guinness stout. The fish was well cooked, juicy fish, and crispy batter pair with the exceptionally made chips and the delicious tar tar sauce. Overall, it was a well-made portion of food, but it lacks that certain wow factor that will bring it to a 5 star. 4.5/5. Would consider to come again when craving comfort food.

I recently visited union jack and was blown away by the delicious fish and chips! The fish was cooked to perfection, with a crispy batter that wasn't too greasy. The chips (fries) were cooked just right, with a nice crunch on the outside and fluffy inside.

The service was friendly and attentive, with a cozy atmosphere that made us feel right at home. The prices were very reasonable, especially considering the generous portion sizes.

We'll definitely be back for more! Highly recommend union jack for anyone craving authentic, mouth-watering fish and chips.
Staff is nice, friendly and supportive! The fish (seabass or cod) and chips are the best I've tried so far. Cottage pie is a little too much cheese but the gravy is just perfect 😭 Highly recommend 🩷

address: 2C Đặng Tiến Đông, An Phú, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 70001, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
A Hidden Gem in Thao Dien – Terraviva Pizza
The food was so good, i gotta write a review right away.
Found a cozy little spot in Thao Dien with chill vibes and friendly staff. Came with a group of 4 and had cold cuts, cured meat pizza (pretty decent), and a ravioli-like dish that was insanely good – definitely the highlight and a must-try!

Tried their Vietnam Pale Ale and Wheat Beer – both were super tropical refreshing and flavorful. Before we left, the owner even gave us a surprise shot with a unique taste – really nice touch!

Overall, a solid 9/10 experience. Will definitely come back for more beer and that amazing pasta dish! 🍺🍝✨

One of the best Italian cusine places in town with both comfort food and fancy(er) options 😆

Food 2.0-Star I want to try and eat everything offered on the menu (but can't! Or else I'll burst)
10/10 Pasta with clam, I haven't tried the full seafood version, but this is seafood enough for me, and it's 🤤🤤🤤 delicious
10/10 (for the eyes and nose) every pizza came out from the oven I got to witness every time sitting by the counter
100/10 Meat Lover 🍕 For those who love a full bite of 🍖, this is for you. Kick it up a notch if you can with the 🌶 oil on top
8/10 Strudel
9/10 Tiramisu

Service 1.0-Star Swift and attentive staff

Price 1.0-Star Price matches the food quality

Environment 0.8-Star Nice and cozy venue, mostly outdoor seating, which can be affected by the hot and humid weather of Saigon.

Overall 4.8-Star 🤩🤩🤩

Well i thought i knew all the pizza in Vietnam but somehow until now i miss out the best. Honestly the best calzone pizza  i  ve tried in Saigon. Very well done, filled with good product and cooked just nice. Nice ambience with good and attentive service. The owner is a nice chap always ready to offer new product , he really like is job. A place you have to try , a bit difficult to find but worth the looking. They have a fantastic private room also. I apologize but i eat without thinking about taking pictures of the food. Cheers...

restaurant_name: Légumes Vietnam - Healthy Groceries, Juice, Acai, Smoothie Bar
address: 40 Nguyễn Cừ, Thảo Điền, Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh 713000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: Familiar local spot for healthy foods and groceries! Nice helpful staffs.

This is one of my favourite stores in Saigon. Everything is home-made, with quality simple ingredients at a good price point. It is perfect for vegans and anybody that is health conscious or wants to try Vietnamese classic snacks without all of the MSG and chemicals. You can also buy huge bags of nuts at really reasonable prices, again all natural without chemicals or additives. I couldn’t recommend this store enough to people looking for healthy natural food.

This shop is perfect for anyone looking for a healthy snack on the go- whether its a refreshing smoothie bowl or revitalizing juice! I’m obsessed with their choco smoothie bowls and protein chocolate chip cookies. No guilt, just good-for-the -body foods! vegan and keto friendly. Staff here are all so sweet. Highly recommend
